page.title: 19Mrs. Smalley
page.content: Mrs.Smalley became blind 26 years ago.An inflammation at the back of the eyes damaged the optic nerves. Adjusting to blindness was very difficult at first. She spent nearly a year in hospital; at first she wouldn't eat because she couldn't see her food; she disliked going out in case she hadn't dressed properly. After a 3 month housewifery course at Bridgenorth, where she met others who were similarly handicapped, she was able to return home and resume her domestic activities. She rejected outside offers of help and insisted on coping herself. Her husband, daughter and son had also to work hard to adjust to the changes. She received her first guide dog, Nesta, 14 years ago. Nesta and Worthy have given her almost as much mobility as a sighted person.
